title: combine-bst
description: Write a function `combine-bst` that takes two binary search trees and returns a new BST containing all unique elements from both trees. The result should be constructed by converting both trees to sorted lists, merging them (removing duplicates), and building a new balanced BST from the merged list.

examples.explanation: Combining two empty trees produces an empty tree
Combining empty tree with single node tree produces the single node tree
Combining two single node trees by inserting 5 into tree with 3

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (combine-bst t1 t2))

(combine-bst empty empty)
(combine-bst empty (make-node empty empty 5))
(combine-bst (make-node empty empty 3) (make-node empty empty 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (combine-bst (make-node empty empty 3) (make-node empty empty 5)) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 5) 3))
(check-expect (combine-bst (make-node empty empty 5) (make-node empty empty 3)) (make-node (make-node empty empty 3) empty 5))
(check-expect (combine-bst (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 1)) (make-node empty empty 1))
(check-expect (combine-bst (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) empty) (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2))

(check-expect (combine-bst (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node empty empty 4)) (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node (make-node empty empty 3) (make-node empty empty 4) 2)))

(check-expect (combine-bst (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 5) 3) (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 6) 4)) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 2) 3) (make-node (make-node empty empty 5) (make-node empty empty 6) 4)))

(check-expect (combine-bst (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 10) 5) (make-node (make-node empty empty 3) empty 7)) (make-node (make-node empty empty 3) (make-node (make-node empty empty 7) (make-node empty empty 10) 5)))

(check-expect (combine-bst (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5) (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 9) 6)) (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 2) 5) (make-node (make-node empty empty 8) (make-node empty empty 9) 6)))
